purpose: The email is a call for papers for a special issue on Responsible Artificial Intelligence in the journal Information Processing & Management. It invites submissions that explore methodologies, implications, and practices related to Responsible AI, emphasizing the need for fair, accountable, transparent, and trustworthy AI systems. The special issue aims to gather interdisciplinary contributions addressing challenges in designing and governing responsible AI systems. The submission deadline is set for October 30, 2025, and the email outlines various topics of interest for potential submissions, as well as guidelines for manuscript submission.

evidence_sentences: Call for Papers: Responsible Artificial Intelligence: Methodologies, Implications, and Practices
This special issue seeks to bring together cutting-edge research, methodologies, and critical reflections on Responsible Artificial Intelligence (RAI).
The issue aims to deepen our understanding of the ethical, legal, technical, and societal dimensions of AI systems.
This special issue will provide a dedicated venue for interdisciplinary contributions addressing key challenges and opportunities in designing, deploying, and governing responsible AI systems.
We invite original, high-quality submissions that contribute substantively to the field of Responsible AI.
All submissions will undergo a single-blind peer-review process coordinated by the guest editors in coordination with the IP&M EiC.
